original: Majjhima Nikāya 135
analyzed: majjhima nikāya
translated: Middle Length Discourses

original: Cūḷakammavibhaṅgasutta
analyzed: cūḷa kamma vibhaṅga sutta
translated: The Shorter Exposition of Action

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane, anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling at Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Park.

original: Atha kho subho māṇavo todeyyaputto yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodi.
analyzed: atha kho subhaḥ māṇavaḥ todeyya puttaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhim sammodi
translated: Then the brahmin student Subha, Todeyya’s son, approached the Blessed One and exchanged greetings with him.

original: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho subho māṇavo todeyyaputto bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho subhaḥ māṇavaḥ todeyya puttaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When this courteous and amiable talk was finished, he sat down at one side and said to the Blessed One:

original: “Ko nu kho, bho gotama, hetu ko paccayo yena manussānaṁyeva sataṁ manussabhūtānaṁ dissanti hīnappaṇītatā?
analyzed: kaḥ nu kho bho gotama hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yena manussā anayā iva satam manussa bhūtānam dissanti hīna ppaṇīta tā
translated: “What is the cause, Master Gotama, what is the reason why among human beings some are seen to be of low wisdom, of low understanding, and some are seen to be of great wisdom, of great understanding?”

original: Dissanti hi, bho gotama, manussā appāyukā, dissanti dīghāyukā;🔽dissanti bavhābādhā, dissanti appābādhā;
analyzed: dissanti hi bho gotama manussāḥ appāyukāḥ dissanti dīghāyukā  dissanti bavhābādhā dissanti appābādhā
translated: “Among human beings, brahmin, some are seen to be short-lived and some are seen to be long-lived; 🔽some are seen to be sickly and some are seen to be healthy;

original: dissanti dubbaṇṇā, dissanti vaṇṇavanto;🔽dissanti appesakkhā, dissanti mahesakkhā;
analyzed: dissanti dubbaṇṇāḥ dissanti vaṇṇavanto  dissanti appesakkhāḥ dissanti mahesakkhāḥ
translated: some are seen to be ugly and some are seen to be beautiful; 🔽some are seen to be uninfluential and some are seen to be influential;

original: dissanti appabhogā, dissanti mahābhogā;
analyzed: dissanti appabhogā dissanti mahā bhogā
translated: some are seen to be poor and some are seen to be wealthy;

original: dissanti nīcakulīnā, dissanti uccākulīnā;
analyzed: dissanti nīca kulīnā dissanti ucca akulīnā
translated: some are of low birth, and some are of high birth;

original: dissanti duppaññā, dissanti paññavanto.
analyzed: dissanti duppaññāḥ dissanti paññavanto
translated: some are unwise, and some are wise.

original: Ko nu kho, bho gotama, hetu ko paccayo yena manussānaṁyeva sataṁ manussabhūtānaṁ dissanti hīnappaṇītatā”ti?
analyzed: kaḥ nu kho bho gotama hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yena manussā anayā iva satam manussa bhūtānam dissanti hīna ppaṇīta tā ati
translated: What is the cause, Master Gotama, what is the reason why among human beings, who are visible now and can be seen, there are those who are inferior and superior?”

original: “Kammassakā, māṇava, sattā kammadāyādā kammayonī kammabandhū kammappaṭisaraṇā.🔽Kammaṁ satte vibhajati yadidaṁ—
analyzed: kammassakā māṇava sattā kamma dāyādā kamma yonī kamma bandhū kamma ppaṭisaraṇā  kammam satte vibhajati
translated: “Monks, beings are owners of their actions, heirs of their actions; they originate from their actions, are bound to their actions, have their actions as their refuge.

original: hīnappaṇītatāyā”ti.
analyzed: hīna ppaṇīta tāya ati
translated: It is action that distinguishes beings as inferior and superior.”

original: “Na kho ahaṁ imassa bhoto gotamassa saṅkhittena bhāsitassa vitthārena atthaṁ avibhattassa vitthārena atthaṁ ājānāmi.
analyzed: na kho aham imassa bhoto gotamassa saṅkhittena bhāsitassa vitthārena attham a vibhattassa vitthārena attham ājānāmi
translated: “I do not understand in detail the meaning of Master Gotama’s statement, which he spoke in brief without expounding the meaning in detail.

original: Sādhu me bhavaṁ gotamo tathā dhammaṁ desetu yathā ahaṁ imassa bhoto gotamassa saṅkhittena bhāsitassa vitthārena atthaṁ avibhattassa vitthārena atthaṁ ājāneyyan”ti.
analyzed: sādhu me bhavam gotamaḥ tathā dhammam desetu yathā aham imassa bhoto gotamassa saṅkhittena bhāsitassa vitthārena attham avibhattassa vitthārena attham ājāneyyanti
translated: It would be good if Master Gotama would teach me the Dhamma so that I might understand in detail the meaning of his statement.”

original: “Tena hi, māṇava, suṇāhi, sādhukaṁ manasi karohi; bhāsissāmī”ti.
analyzed: tena hi māṇava suṇāhi sādhukam manasi karohi bhāsissāmi iti
translated: “Then listen and attend closely to what I shall say.”

original: “Evaṁ, bho”ti kho subho māṇavo todeyyaputto bhagavato paccassosi.
analyzed: eva bhoti kho subhaḥ māṇavaḥ todeyya putto bhagavataḥ paccassosi
translated: “Yes, sir,” Subha replied.

original: Bhagavā etadavoca:
analyzed: bhagavān etat avoca
translated: The Buddha said this:

original: “Idha, māṇava, ekacco itthī vā puriso vā pāṇātipātī hoti luddo lohitapāṇi hatapahate niviṭṭho adayāpanno pāṇabhūtesu.
analyzed: idha māṇava ekaccaḥ itthī vā purisaḥ vā pāṇa atipātī hoti luddaḥ lohita pāṇi hata pahate niviṭṭhaḥ adaya āpannaḥ pāṇa bhūtesu
translated: “Here, student, some man or woman kills living beings and is murderous, bloody-handed, given to blows and violence, without mercy for living beings.

original: So tena kammena evaṁ samattena evaṁ samādinnena kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjati.
analyzed: so tena kammena evam sa mattena evam samādinnena kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapajjati
translated: Because of performing and carrying out such actions, on the break-up of the body, after death, he is reborn in a bad destination, a lower realm, a place of suffering, hell.

original: No ce kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjati, sace manussattaṁ āgacchati yattha yattha paccājāyati appāyuko hoti.
analyzed: no ce kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapajjati sace manussattam āgacchati yattha yattha paccājāyati appāyukaḥ hoti
translated: If, on the break-up of the body, after death, he is not reborn in a bad destination, a lower realm, a place of suffering, hell, but instead comes back to the human state, then wherever he is reborn he is short-lived.

original: Appāyukasaṁvattanikā esā, māṇava, paṭipadā yadidaṁ—
analyzed: esā māṇava paṭipadā yat ida
translated: Because of performing and carrying out such actions, this is the path, student, that leads to short life, namely,

original: pāṇātipātī hoti luddo lohitapāṇi hatapahate niviṭṭho adayāpanno pāṇabhūtesu.
analyzed: pāṇa atipātī hoti luddaḥ lohita pāṇi hata pahate niviṭṭhaḥ adaya āpannaḥ pāṇabhūtesu
translated: killing living beings and being murderous, bloody-handed, given to blows and violence, without mercy for living beings.

original: Idha pana, māṇava, ekacco itthī vā puriso vā pāṇātipātaṁ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti nihitadaṇḍo nihitasattho, lajjī dayāpanno sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampī viharati.
analyzed: idha pana māṇava ekaccaḥ itthī vā purisaḥ vā pāṇa atipātam pahāya pāṇa atipātā paṭivirataḥ hoti nihita daṇḍaḥ nihita satthaḥ lajjī dayā āpannaḥ sabba pāṇa bhūta hita anukampī viharati
translated: “Here, student, someone, abandoning the killing of living beings, abstains from killing living beings; with rod and weapon laid aside, gentle and kindly, he abides compassionate to all living beings.

original: So tena kammena evaṁ samattena evaṁ samādinnena kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjati.
analyzed: so tena kammena evam samattena evam samādinnena kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjati
translated: “With the breakup of the body, after death, he is reborn in companionship with the devas who delight in creation.

original: No ce kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjati, sace manussattaṁ āgacchati yattha yattha paccājāyati dīghāyuko hoti.
analyzed: no ce kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjati sace manussattam āgacchati yattha yattha paccājāyati dīgha āyukaḥ hoti
translated: If, on the breakup of the body, after death, he is not reborn in companionship with the devas who delight in creation, then if he comes back to the human state, wherever he is reborn he is long-lived.

original: Dīghāyukasaṁvattanikā esā, māṇava, paṭipadā yadidaṁ—
analyzed: esā māṇava paṭipadā yat ida
translated: “This, student, is the way leading to long life, namely,

original: pāṇātipātaṁ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti nihitadaṇḍo nihitasattho, lajjī dayāpanno sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampī viharati.
analyzed: pāṇa atipātam pahāya pāṇa atipātā paṭivirataḥ hoti nihita daṇḍaḥ nihita satthaḥ lajjī dayā āpannaḥ sabba pāṇa bhūta hita anukampī viharati
translated: abandoning the killing of living beings, he abstains from killing living beings; with rod and weapon laid aside, gentle and merciful, he abides compassionate to all living beings.

original: Idha, māṇava, ekacco itthī vā puriso vā sattānaṁ viheṭhakajātiko hoti, pāṇinā vā leḍḍunā vā daṇḍena vā satthena vā.🔽So tena kammena evaṁ samattena evaṁ samādinnena kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjati.
analyzed: idha māṇava ekaccaḥ itthī vā purisaḥ vā sattānam viheṭhaka jātikaḥ hoti pāṇinā vā leḍḍunā vā daṇḍena vā satthena vā  so tena kammena evam sa mattena evam samādinnena kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapajjati
translated: “Here, student, someone is of a kind to harm beings with his bodily actions, with his speech, and with his thoughts.🔽With the breakup of the body, after death, he is reborn in hell.🔽If he comes back to the human state, then wherever he is reborn he is sickly.

original: No ce kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjati, sace manussattaṁ āgacchati yattha yattha paccājāyati bavhābādho hoti.🔽Bavhābādhasaṁvattanikā esā, māṇava, paṭipadā yadidaṁ—🔽sattānaṁ viheṭhakajātiko hoti pāṇinā vā leḍḍunā vā daṇḍena vā satthena vā.
analyzed: no ce kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapajjati sace manussattam āgacchati yattha yattha paccājāyati bavhābādhaḥ hoti  esā māṇava paṭipadā yat ida  sattānam viheṭhaka jātikaḥ hoti pāṇinā vā leḍḍunā vā daṇḍena vā satthena vā
translated: Because of undertaking that kind of kamma, that kind of action, this comes to pass.

original: Idha pana, māṇava, ekacco itthī vā puriso vā sattānaṁ aviheṭhakajātiko hoti pāṇinā vā leḍḍunā vā daṇḍena vā satthena vā.
analyzed: idha pana māṇava ekaccaḥ itthī vā purisaḥ vā sattānam a viheṭhaka jātikaḥ hoti pāṇinā vā leḍḍunā vā daṇḍena vā satthena vā
translated: “Here, student, someone is of a kind to not harm beings with his bodily actions, with his speech, and with his thoughts.

original: So tena kammena evaṁ samattena evaṁ samādinnena kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjati.
analyzed: so tena kammena evam samattena evam samādinnena kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjati
translated: As a result of performing and completing such action, on the dissolution of the body, after death, he reappears in a good destination, in the heavenly world.

original: No ce kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjati, sace manussattaṁ āgacchati yattha yattha paccājāyati appābādho hoti.
analyzed: no ce kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjati sace manussattam āgacchati yattha yattha paccājāyati appa ābādhaḥ hoti
translated: But if he does not reappear in a good destination, in the heavenly world, but instead comes back to the human state, then wherever he is reborn he is free from illness.

original: Appābādhasaṁvattanikā esā, māṇava, paṭipadā yadidaṁ—
analyzed: esā māṇava paṭipadā yat ida
translated: This is the way, student, that leads to freedom from illness, namely,

original: sattānaṁ aviheṭhakajātiko hoti pāṇinā vā leḍḍunā vā daṇḍena vā satthena vā.
analyzed: sattānam a viheṭhaka jātikaḥ hoti pāṇinā vā leḍḍunā vā daṇḍena vā satthena vā
translated: one does not harm beings with the fist, clod, stick, or sword.

original: Idha, māṇava, ekacco itthī vā puriso vā kodhano hoti upāyāsabahulo.
analyzed: idha māṇava ekaccaḥ itthī vā purisaḥ vā kodhanaḥ hoti upāyāsa bahulaḥ
translated: “Here, student, some man or woman is angry and full of hatred.

original: Appampi vutto samāno abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patiṭṭhīyati kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti.
analyzed: appampi vuttaḥ samānaḥ abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patiṭṭhīyati kopam ca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti
translated: When spoken to offensively, he becomes even more offensive. When spoken to harshly, he becomes even more harsh. When spoken to offensively and harshly, he becomes even more offensive and harsh.

original: So tena kammena evaṁ samattena evaṁ samādinnena kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjati.
analyzed: so tena kammena evam sa mattena evam samādinnena kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapajjati
translated: As a result of performing and completing such action, on the dissolution of the body, after death, he reappears in a state of deprivation, in an unhappy destination, in perdition, even in hell.

original: No ce kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjati, sace manussattaṁ āgacchati yattha yattha paccājāyati dubbaṇṇo hoti.
analyzed: no ce kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapajjati sace manussattam āgacchati yattha yattha paccājāyati dubbaṇṇaḥ hoti
translated: If, on the dissolution of the body, after death, he does not reappear in a happy destination, in the heavenly world, but instead comes back to the human state, then wherever he is reborn he is ugly.

original: Dubbaṇṇasaṁvattanikā esā, māṇava, paṭipadā yadidaṁ—
analyzed: esā māṇava paṭipadā yat ida
translated: “This, student, is the way that leads to ugliness, namely,

original: kodhano hoti upāyāsabahulo;
analyzed: kodhanaḥ hoti upāyāsa bahulaḥ
translated: one is angry and full of resentment.

original: appampi vutto samāno abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patiṭṭhīyati kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti.
analyzed: appampi vuttaḥ samānaḥ abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patiṭṭhīyati kopam ca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti
translated: Even when spoken to mildly, one is not mild but becomes all the more angry, bitter, and resentful.

original: Idha pana, māṇava, ekacco itthī vā puriso vā akkodhano hoti anupāyāsabahulo;
analyzed: idha pana māṇava ekaccaḥ itthī vā purisaḥ vā akkodhanaḥ hoti an upāyāsa bahulaḥ
translated: “Here, student, someone is not angry and full of resentment.

original: bahumpi vutto samāno nābhisajjati na kuppati na byāpajjati na patiṭṭhīyati na kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti.
analyzed: bahum pi vuttaḥ samānaḥ na abhisajjati na kuppati na byāpajjati na patiṭṭhīyati na kopam ca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti
translated: Even when spoken to harshly, one is not harsh but becomes mild, not angry, not bitter, and not resentful.

original: So tena kammena evaṁ samattena evaṁ samādinnena kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjati.
analyzed: so tena kammena evam samattena evam samādinnena kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjati
translated: With the breakup of the body, after death, he is reborn in a good destination, in a heavenly world.

original: No ce kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjati, sace manussattaṁ āgacchati yattha yattha paccājāyati pāsādiko hoti.
analyzed: no ce kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjati sace manussattam āgacchati yattha yattha paccājāyati pāsādikaḥ hoti
translated: If, on the dissolution of the body, after death, he does not reappear in a happy destination, in the heavenly world, but instead comes back to the human state, then wherever he is reborn he is well-favored.

original: Pāsādikasaṁvattanikā esā, māṇava, paṭipadā yadidaṁ—
analyzed: pāsādika savattanikā esā māṇava paṭipadā yat ida
translated: “The practice that leads to being well-favored, student, is this:

original: akkodhano hoti anupāyāsabahulo;
analyzed: a kkodhanaḥ hoti an upāyāsa bahulaḥ
translated: One is not angry or revengeful.

original: bahumpi vutto samāno nābhisajjati na kuppati na byāpajjati na patiṭṭhīyati na kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti.
analyzed: bahum pi vuttaḥ samānaḥ na abhisajjati na kuppati na byāpajjati na patiṭṭhīyati na kopam ca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti
translated: Even when criticized a lot, one does not get angry, does not get irritated, does not get upset, does not display anger, irritation, or vexation.

original: Idha, māṇava, ekacco itthī vā puriso vā issāmanako hoti;
analyzed: idha māṇava ekaccaḥ itthī vā purisaḥ vā issāmanakaḥ hoti
translated: “Here, student, some man or woman is envious.

original: paralābhasakkāragarukāramānanavandanapūjanāsu issati upadussati issaṁ bandhati.
analyzed: para lābha sakkāra garukāra mānana vandana pūjanāsu issati upadussati issam bandhati
translated: He envies, resents, & is jealous of the gains, honor, respect, reverence, salutations, & veneration that others get.

original: So tena kammena evaṁ samattena evaṁ samādinnena kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjati.
analyzed: so tena kammena evam sa mattena evam samādinnena kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapajjati
translated: Through his doing an action rooted in envy, instigated by envy, with a mind imbued with envy, on the break-up of the body, after death, he reappears in a plane of deprivation, a bad destination, a lower realm, hell.

original: No ce kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjati, sace manussattaṁ āgacchati yattha yattha paccājāyati appesakkho hoti.
analyzed: no ce kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapajjati sace manussattam āgacchati yattha yattha paccājāyati appesakkhaḥ hoti
translated: If, on the dissolution of the body, after death, he does not reappear in a state of deprivation, in an unhappy destination, in perdition, even in hell, but instead comes back to the human state, then wherever he is reborn he is poor.

original: Appesakkhasaṁvattanikā esā, māṇava, paṭipadā yadidaṁ—
analyzed: esā māṇava paṭipadā yat idam
translated: This is the way, student, that leads to being poor, namely,

original: issāmanako hoti;
analyzed: issāmanakaḥ hoti
translated: being envious.

original: paralābhasakkāragarukāramānanavandanapūjanāsu issati upadussati issaṁ bandhati.
analyzed: para lābha sakkāra garukāra mānana vandana pūjanāsu issati upadussati issam bandhati
translated: One envies and is jealous of the gains, honor, respect, reverence, salutations, and veneration received by others.

original: Idha pana, māṇava, ekacco itthī vā puriso vā anissāmanako hoti;
analyzed: idha pana māṇava ekaccaḥ itthī vā purisaḥ vā a nissāmanakaḥ hoti
translated: “Here, student, someone is not envious.

original: paralābhasakkāragarukāramānanavandanapūjanāsu na issati na upadussati na issaṁ bandhati.🔽So tena kammena evaṁ samattena evaṁ samādinnena kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjati.
analyzed: para lābha sakkāra garukāra mānana vandana pūjanāsu na issati na upadussati na issam bandhati  so tena kammena evam samattena evam samādinnena kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjati
translated: One does not envy and is not jealous of the gains, honor, respect, reverence, salutations, and veneration received by others.🔽With the breakup of the body, after death, he is reborn in a good destination, in a heavenly world.

original: No ce kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjati, sace manussattaṁ āgacchati yattha yattha paccājāyati mahesakkho hoti.
analyzed: no ce kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjati sace manussattam āgacchati yattha yattha paccājāyati mahesakkhaḥ hoti
translated: If, on the dissolution of the body, after death, he does not reappear in a state of deprivation, in an unhappy destination, in perdition, even in hell, but instead comes back to the human state, then wherever he is reborn he is wealthy.

original: Mahesakkhasaṁvattanikā esā, māṇava, paṭipadā yadidaṁ—
analyzed: mahesakkhasavattanikā esā māṇava paṭipadā yat idam
translated: This is the way, student, that leads to greatness, namely:

original: anissāmanako hoti;
analyzed: a nissāmanakaḥ hoti
translated: not being envious.

original: paralābhasakkāragarukāramānanavandanapūjanāsu na issati na upadussati na issaṁ bandhati.
analyzed: para lābha sakkāra garukāra mānana vandana pūjanāsu na issati na upadussati na issam bandhati
translated: One does not envy or begrudge the gains, honor, respect, reverence, salutations, and veneration received by others.

original: Idha, māṇava, ekacco itthī vā puriso vā na dātā hoti samaṇassa vā brāhmaṇassa vā annaṁ pānaṁ vatthaṁ yānaṁ mālāgandhavilepanaṁ seyyāvasathapadīpeyyaṁ.
analyzed: idha māṇava ekaccaḥ itthī vā purisaḥ vā na dātā hoti samaṇassa vā brāhmaṇassa vā annam pānam vattham yānam mālā gandha vilepanam seyya āvasatha padīpeyya
translated: Here, student, someone is not a giver of food, drink, clothing, vehicles, garlands, scents, unguents, beds, dwellings, or lights to a contemplative or a brahman.

original: So tena kammena evaṁ samattena evaṁ samādinnena kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjati.
analyzed: so tena kammena evam sa mattena evam samādinnena kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapajjati
translated: With the breakup of the body, after death, he is reborn in a lower realm, a bad realm, a fallen state, hell.

original: No ce kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjati, sace manussattaṁ āgacchati yattha yattha paccājāyati appabhogo hoti.🔽Appabhogasaṁvattanikā esā, māṇava, paṭipadā yadidaṁ—
analyzed: no ce kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapajjati sace manussattam āgacchati yattha yattha paccājāyati appabhogaḥ hoti 🔽appabhoga savattanikā esā māṇava paṭipadā yat ida
translated: If, with the breakup of the body, after death, he is not reborn in a lower realm, a bad realm, a fallen state, hell, but instead comes back to the human state, then wherever he is reborn he is poor.

original: na dātā hoti samaṇassa vā brāhmaṇassa vā annaṁ pānaṁ vatthaṁ yānaṁ mālāgandhavilepanaṁ seyyāvasathapadīpeyyaṁ.
analyzed: na dātā hoti samaṇassa vā brāhmaṇassa vā annam pānam vattham yānam mālā gandha vilepanam seyya āvasatha padīpeyya
translated: He does not give food, drink, clothing, vehicles, garlands, scents, ointments, beds, dwellings, or lamps to ascetics or brahmins.

original: Idha pana, māṇava, ekacco itthī vā puriso vā dātā hoti samaṇassa vā brāhmaṇassa vā annaṁ pānaṁ vatthaṁ yānaṁ mālāgandhavilepanaṁ seyyāvasathapadīpeyyaṁ.
analyzed: idha pana māṇava ekaccaḥ itthī vā purisaḥ vā dātā hoti samaṇassa vā brāhmaṇassa vā annam pānam vattham yānam mālā gandha vilepanam seyya āvasatha padīpeyya
translated: “Here, student, some man or woman does not kill living beings, does not take what is not given, does not misconduct himself in sensual pleasures, does not speak falsehood, and does not encourage others to do likewise.

original: So tena kammena evaṁ samattena evaṁ samādinnena kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjati.
analyzed: so tena kammena evam samattena evam samādinnena kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjati
translated: “By reason of his action, by reason of his deeds, on the dissolution of the body, after death, he reappears in a happy destination, even in the heavenly world.

original: No ce kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjati, sace manussattaṁ āgacchati yattha yattha paccājāyati mahābhogo hoti.
analyzed: no ce kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjati sace manussattam āgacchati yattha yattha paccājāyati mahā bhogaḥ hoti
translated: If, on the dissolution of the body, after death, he does not reappear in a happy destination, even in the heavenly world, but instead comes back to the human state, then wherever he is reborn he is wealthy.

original: Mahābhogasaṁvattanikā esā, māṇava, paṭipadā yadidaṁ—
analyzed: mahā bhoga savattanikā esā māṇava paṭipadā yat ida
translated: “This, student, is the way leading to wealth, namely,

original: dātā hoti samaṇassa vā brāhmaṇassa vā annaṁ pānaṁ vatthaṁ yānaṁ mālāgandhavilepanaṁ seyyāvasathapadīpeyyaṁ.
analyzed: dātā hoti samaṇassa vā brāhmaṇassa vā annam pānam vattham yānam mālā gandha vilepanam seyya āvasatha padīpeyya
translated: giving food, drink, clothing, vehicles, garlands, scents, ointments, beds, dwellings, and lamps to ascetics and brahmins.”

original: Idha, māṇava, ekacco itthī vā puriso vā thaddho hoti atimānī—🔽abhivādetabbaṁ na abhivādeti, paccuṭṭhātabbaṁ na paccuṭṭheti, āsanārahassa na āsanaṁ🔽deti, maggārahassa na maggaṁ deti, sakkātabbaṁ na sakkaroti, garukātabbaṁ na garukaroti,
analyzed: idha māṇava ekaccaḥ itthī vā purisaḥ vā thaddhaḥ hoti atimānī  abhivādetabbam na abhivādeti paccuṭṭhātabbam na paccuṭṭheti āsanā rahassa na āsana  deti maggārahassa na maggam deti sakkātabbam na sakkaroti garukātabbam na garukaroti
translated: “Here, student, someone is obstinate and arrogant,

original: mānetabbaṁ na māneti, pūjetabbaṁ na pūjeti.
analyzed: mānetabbam na māneti pūjetabbam na pūjeti
translated: he does not greet or give way to the elder bhikkhus as is proper and seemly; he does not give them respectful address, rise up for them, salute them with joined palms, and do them homage; he does not consent to being corrected by them; he does not admit his faults to them and does not make amends for them in accordance with the Dhamma.

original: So tena kammena evaṁ samattena evaṁ samādinnena kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjati.
analyzed: so tena kammena evam sa mattena evam samādinnena kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapajjati
translated: As a result of performing and completing such action, after the break-up of the body, after death, he is reborn in hell.🔽But if he comes back to the human state, then wherever he is reborn he is poor.

original: No ce kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjati, sace manussattaṁ āgacchati yattha yattha paccājāyati nīcakulīno hoti.
analyzed: no ce kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapajjati sace manussattam āgacchati yattha yattha paccājāyati nīca kulīnaḥ hoti
translated: “This, student, is the way that is easy to travel and easy to pursue that leads to heaven, leads to what is desirable, pleasing, agreeable, to welfare and happiness.

original: Nīcakulīnasaṁvattanikā esā, māṇava, paṭipadā yadidaṁ—🔽thaddho hoti atimānī;
analyzed: esā māṇava paṭipadā yat ida 🔽thaddhaḥ hoti atimānī
translated: “Here, student, someone is obstinate and arrogant,

original: abhivādetabbaṁ na abhivādeti, paccuṭṭhātabbaṁ na paccuṭṭheti, āsanārahassa na āsanaṁ🔽deti, maggārahassa na maggaṁ deti, sakkātabbaṁ na sakkaroti, garukātabbaṁ na garukaroti,
analyzed: abhivādetabbam na abhivādeti paccuṭṭhātabbam na paccuṭṭheti āsanā rahassa na āsana  deti maggārahassa na maggam deti sakkātabbam na sakkaroti garukātabbam na garukaroti
translated: he does not bow down to those worthy of a bow, does not rise up for those worthy of rising up for, does not give a seat to those worthy of a seat,

original: mānetabbaṁ na māneti, pūjetabbaṁ na pūjeti.
analyzed: mānetabbam na māneti pūjetabbam na pūjeti
translated: does not make way for those worthy of being given way to, does not honor, respect, revere, and venerate those worthy of being honored, respected, revered, and venerated.

original: Idha pana, māṇava, ekacco itthī vā puriso vā atthaddho hoti anatimānī;
analyzed: idha pana māṇava ekaccaḥ itthī vā purisaḥ vā atthaddhaḥ hoti an atimānī
translated: “Here, student, some man or woman is not greedy, not contemptuous,

original: abhivādetabbaṁ abhivādeti, paccuṭṭhātabbaṁ paccuṭṭheti, āsanārahassa āsanaṁ deti,🔽maggārahassa maggaṁ deti, sakkātabbaṁ sakkaroti, garukātabbaṁ garukaroti, mānetabbaṁ
analyzed: abhivādetabbam abhivādeti paccuṭṭhātabbam paccuṭṭheti āsanā rahassaḥ āsanam deti  maggārahassa maggam deti sakkātabbam sakkaroti garukātabbam garukaroti
translated: he bows down to those worthy of a bow, rises up for those worthy of rising up for, gives a seat to those worthy of a seat,

original: māneti, pūjetabbaṁ pūjeti.
analyzed: māneti pūjetabbam pūjā iti
translated: makes way for those worthy of being given way to, honors, respects, reveres, and venerates those worthy of being honored, respected, revered, and venerated.

original: So tena kammena evaṁ samattena evaṁ samādinnena kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjati.
analyzed: so tena kammena evam samattena evam samādinnena kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjati
translated: Through that action, when his body breaks up, after death, he is reborn in a good destination, in a heavenly world.

original: No ce kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjati, sace manussattaṁ āgacchati yattha yattha paccājāyati uccākulīno hoti.
analyzed: no ce kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjati sace manussattam āgacchati yattha yattha paccājāyati ucca akulīnaḥ hoti
translated: If, on the dissolution of the body, after death, he does not reappear in a happy destination, in the heavenly world, but instead comes back to the human state, then wherever he is reborn he is well off.

original: Uccākulīnasaṁvattanikā esā, māṇava, paṭipadā yadidaṁ—🔽atthaddho hoti anatimānī;
analyzed: esā māṇava paṭipadā yat ida  atthaddhaḥ hoti an atimānī
translated: “This, student, is the way that leads to being well off, namely,🔽being generous, openhanded, delighting in relinquishing, devoted to charity, unselfish, and committed to giving and sharing.

original: abhivādetabbaṁ abhivādeti, paccuṭṭhātabbaṁ paccuṭṭheti, āsanārahassa āsanaṁ deti,🔽maggārahassa maggaṁ deti, sakkātabbaṁ sakkaroti, garukātabbaṁ garukaroti, mānetabbaṁ
analyzed: abhivādetabbam abhivādeti paccuṭṭhātabbam paccuṭṭheti āsanā rahassaḥ āsanam deti  maggārahassa maggam deti sakkātabbam sakkaroti garukātabbam garukaroti
translated: He pays homage to those worthy of veneration,🔽he rises up for those for whom he should rise up, he offers seats to those who deserve a seat,

original: māneti, pūjetabbaṁ pūjeti.
analyzed: māneti pūjetabbam pūjā iti
translated: he offers almsfood to those who need almsfood, he offers dwelling to those who need a dwelling, and he offers medicine to those who need medicine.

original: Idha, māṇava, ekacco itthī vā puriso vā samaṇaṁ vā brāhmaṇaṁ vā upasaṅkamitvā na paripucchitā hoti:
analyzed: idha māṇava ekaccaḥ itthī vā purisaḥ vā samaṇam vā brāhmaṇam vā upasaṅkamitvā na paripucchitā hoti
translated: “Here, student, some man or woman does not approach a contemplative or a brahman and ask:

original: ‘kiṁ, bhante, kusalaṁ, kiṁ akusalaṁ;🔽kiṁ sāvajjaṁ, kiṁ anavajjaṁ;
analyzed: kim bhante kusala kim akusala  kim sā avajja kim an avajja
translated: ‘What, venerable sir, is wholesome? What is unwholesome?🔽What is blameworthy? What is blameless?

original: kiṁ sevitabbaṁ, kiṁ na sevitabbaṁ;
analyzed: kim sevitabba kim na sevitabba
translated: What should be cultivated? What should not be cultivated?🔽What, when I do it, will be for my long-term harm & suffering? Or what, when I do it, will be for my long-term welfare & happiness?’

original: kiṁ me karīyamānaṁ dīgharattaṁ ahitāya dukkhāya hoti, kiṁ vā pana me karīyamānaṁ dīgharattaṁ hitāya sukhāya hotī’ti?
analyzed: kim me karīyamānam dīgharattam ahitāya dukkhāya hoti kim vā pana me karīyamānam dīgharattam hitāya sukhāya hoti iti
translated: What, when I do it, will be for my long-term harm & suffering? What, when I do it, will be for my long-term benefit & happiness?’

original: So tena kammena evaṁ samattena evaṁ samādinnena kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjati.
analyzed: so tena kammena evam sa mattena evam samādinnena kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapajjati
translated: “When he has done that deed, when it has been done, he is reborn in hell, in the animal womb, or in the realm of hungry shades.

original: No ce kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjati, sace manussattaṁ āgacchati yattha yattha paccājāyati duppañño hoti.
analyzed: no ce kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapajjati sace manussattam āgacchati yattha yattha paccājāyati duppaññaḥ hoti
translated: If, when his body breaks up, after death, he is not reborn in hell, in the animal womb, or in the realm of hungry shades, but instead comes back to the human state, then wherever he is reborn he is dull.

original: Duppaññasaṁvattanikā esā, māṇava, paṭipadā yadidaṁ—
analyzed: esā māṇava paṭipadā yat idam
translated: “This, student, is the path, the way to dullness:

original: samaṇaṁ vā brāhmaṇaṁ vā upasaṅkamitvā na paripucchitā hoti:🔽‘kiṁ, bhante, kusalaṁ, kiṁ akusalaṁ;🔽kiṁ sāvajjaṁ, kiṁ anavajjaṁ;
analyzed: samaṇam vā brāhmaṇam vā upasaṅkamitvā na paripucchitā  kim bhante kusala kim akusala  kim sā avajja kim an avajja
translated: one does not go to a contemplative or a brahman and ask,🔽‘Which things, when doing them, lead to my long-term harm & suffering?

original: kiṁ sevitabbaṁ, kiṁ na sevitabbaṁ;
analyzed: kim sevitabba kim na sevitabba
translated: Which things, when doing them, lead to my long-term benefit & happiness?’

original: kiṁ me karīyamānaṁ dīgharattaṁ ahitāya dukkhāya hoti, kiṁ vā pana me karīyamānaṁ dīgharattaṁ hitāya sukhāya hotī’ti?
analyzed: kim me karīyamānam dīgharattam ahitāya dukkhāya hoti kim vā pana me karīyamānam dīgharattam hitāya sukhāya hoti iti
translated: What, when I do it, will be for my long-lasting harm & suffering? What, when I do it, will be for my long-lasting welfare & happiness?’

original: Idha pana, māṇava, ekacco itthī vā puriso vā samaṇaṁ vā brāhmaṇaṁ vā upasaṅkamitvā paripucchitā hoti:
analyzed: idha pana māṇava ekaccaḥ itthī vā purisaḥ vā samaṇam vā brāhmaṇam vā upasaṅkamitvā paripucchitā hoti
translated: “Then there is the case where a certain woman or man goes to a contemplative or a brahman and, on arriving, asks:

original: ‘kiṁ, bhante, kusalaṁ, kiṁ akusalaṁ;
analyzed: kim bhante kusala kim akusala
translated: ‘What, venerable sir, is skillful? What is unskillful?

original: kiṁ sāvajjaṁ, kiṁ anavajjaṁ;
analyzed: kim sā avajja kim an avajja
translated: What is blameworthy? What is blameless?

original: kiṁ sevitabbaṁ, kiṁ na sevitabbaṁ;
analyzed: kim sevitabba kim na sevitabba
translated: What should be cultivated? What should not be cultivated?

original: kiṁ me karīyamānaṁ dīgharattaṁ ahitāya dukkhāya hoti, kiṁ vā pana me karīyamānaṁ dīgharattaṁ hitāya sukhāya hotī’ti?
analyzed: kim me karīyamānam dīgharattam ahitāya dukkhāya hoti kim vā pana me karīyamānam dīgharattam hitāya sukhāya hoti iti
translated: What, when I do it, will be for my long-lasting harm & suffering? What, when I do it, will be for my long-lasting welfare & happiness?’

original: So tena kammena evaṁ samattena evaṁ samādinnena kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjati.
analyzed: so tena kammena evam samattena evam samādinnena kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjati
translated: “Then, with the break-up of the body, after death, he/she re-appears in a good destination, a heavenly world.

original: No ce kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjati, sace manussattaṁ āgacchati yattha yattha paccājāyati mahāpañño hoti.
analyzed: no ce kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjati sace manussattam āgacchati yattha yattha paccājāyati mahā paññaḥ hoti
translated: If, with the break-up of the body, after death, he/she doesn’t reappear in a good destination, a heavenly world, but instead comes back to the human state, then wherever he/she is reborn, he/she is wise.

original: Mahāpaññasaṁvattanikā esā, māṇava, paṭipadā yadidaṁ—
analyzed: mahā paññasavattanikā esā māṇava paṭipadā yat idam
translated: This is the way, student, that leads to great wisdom,

original: samaṇaṁ vā brāhmaṇaṁ vā upasaṅkamitvā paripucchitā hoti:
analyzed: samaṇam vā brāhmaṇam vā upasaṅkamitvā paripucchitā hoti
translated: that is, approaching an ascetic or a brahmin and asking:

original: ‘kiṁ, bhante, kusalaṁ, kiṁ akusalaṁ;
analyzed: kim bhante kusala kim akusala
translated: ‘Venerable sir, what is wholesome? What is unwholesome?

original: kiṁ sāvajjaṁ, kiṁ anavajjaṁ;
analyzed: kim sā avajja kim an avajja
translated: What is blameable? What is blameless?

original: kiṁ sevitabbaṁ, kiṁ na sevitabbaṁ;
analyzed: kim sevitabba kim na sevitabba
translated: What should be cultivated? What should not be cultivated?

original: kiṁ me karīyamānaṁ dīgharattaṁ ahitāya dukkhāya hoti, kiṁ vā pana me karīyamānaṁ dīgharattaṁ hitāya sukhāya hotī’ti?
analyzed: kim me karīyamānam dīgharattam ahitāya dukkhāya hoti kim vā pana me karīyamānam dīgharattam hitāya sukhāya hoti iti
translated: What, when I do it, will be for my long-term harm and suffering? Or what, when I do it, will be for my long-term welfare and happiness?’

original: Iti kho, māṇava, appāyukasaṁvattanikā paṭipadā appāyukattaṁ upaneti, dīghāyukasaṁvattanikā paṭipadā dīghāyukattaṁ upaneti;🔽bavhābādhasaṁvattanikā paṭipadā bavhābādhattaṁ upaneti, appābādhasaṁvattanikā paṭipadā appābādhattaṁ upaneti;
analyzed: iti kho māṇava appāyuka savattanikā paṭipadā appāyuka ttam upaneti dīghāyuka savattanikā paṭipadā dīghāyuka ttam upaneti  bavhābādha savattanikā paṭipadā bavhābādha ttam upaneti appābādha savattanikā paṭipadā appābādha ttam upaneti
translated: Thus, student, the way that leads to short life makes one short-lived,🔽the way that leads to long life makes one long-lived;🔽the way that leads to sickliness makes one sickly, the way that leads to health makes one healthy;

original: dubbaṇṇasaṁvattanikā paṭipadā dubbaṇṇattaṁ upaneti, pāsādikasaṁvattanikā paṭipadā pāsādikattaṁ upaneti;
analyzed: dubbaṇṇa savattanikā paṭipadā dubbaṇṇa ttam upaneti pāsādika savattanikā paṭipadā pāsādika ttam upaneti
translated: the way that leads to ugliness makes one ugly, the way that leads to being beautiful makes one beautiful;

original: appesakkhasaṁvattanikā paṭipadā appesakkhattaṁ upaneti, mahesakkhasaṁvattanikā paṭipadā mahesakkhattaṁ upaneti;🔽appabhogasaṁvattanikā paṭipadā appabhogattaṁ upaneti, mahābhogasaṁvattanikā paṭipadā mahābhogattaṁ upaneti;
analyzed: appesakkhasavattanikā paṭipadā appesakkhattam upaneti mahesakkhasavattanikā paṭipadā mahesakkhattam upaneti  appabhoga savattanikā paṭipadā appabhoga ttam upaneti mahābhoga savattanikā paṭipadā mahābhoga ttam upaneti
translated: The way that leads to low birth leads to low birth.🔽The way that leads to wealth leads to wealth.🔽The way that leads to a low family leads to a low family.

original: nīcakulīnasaṁvattanikā paṭipadā nīcakulīnattaṁ upaneti, uccākulīnasaṁvattanikā paṭipadā uccākulīnattaṁ upaneti;
analyzed: nīca kulīna savattanikā paṭipadā nīca kulīna ttam upaneti ucca akulīna savattanikā paṭipadā ucca akulīna ttam upaneti
translated: The way that leads to a high family leads to a high family.🔽The way that leads to little wisdom leads to little wisdom.

original: duppaññasaṁvattanikā paṭipadā duppaññattaṁ upaneti, mahāpaññasaṁvattanikā paṭipadā mahāpaññattaṁ upaneti.🔽Kammassakā, māṇava, sattā kammadāyādā kammayonī kammabandhū kammappaṭisaraṇā.
analyzed: duppaññasavattanikā paṭipadā duppaññattam upaneti mahāpaññasavattanikā paṭipadā mahāpaññattam upaneti  kammassakā māṇava sattā kamma dāyādā kamma yonī kamma bandhū kamma ppaṭisaraṇā
translated: The way that leads to great wisdom leads to great wisdom.

original: Kammaṁ satte vibhajati yadidaṁ—
analyzed: kammam satte vibhajati
translated: “Young man, beings are owners of their actions, heirs of their actions; they originate from their actions, are bound to their actions, have their actions as their refuge.

original: hīnappaṇītatāyā”ti.
analyzed: hīna ppaṇīta tāya ati
translated: It is action that distinguishes beings as inferior and superior.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, subho māṇavo todeyyaputto bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte subhaḥ māṇavaḥ todeyya puttaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, Subha, Todeyya’s son, said to the Blessed One:

original: “abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama, abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama.
analyzed: abhikkanta bho gotama abhikkanta bho gotama
translated: “Magnificent, Master Gotama! Magnificent!🔽Just as if he were to place upright what was overturned, to reveal what was hidden, to show the way to one who was lost, or to carry a lamp into the dark so that those with eyes could see forms,🔽in the same way has Master Gotama—through many lines of reasoning—made the Dhamma clear.🔽I go to Master Gotama for refuge and to the Dhamma and to the Sangha of bhikkhus.

original: Seyyathāpi, bho gotama, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa
analyzed: seyyathā api bho gotama nikkujjitam vā ukkujjeyya paṭicchannam vā vivareyya mūḷhassa
translated: or reveal what is hidden, or show the way to one who is lost,

original: vā maggaṁ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṁ dhāreyya: ‘cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī’ti;
analyzed: vā maggam ācikkheyya andhakāre vā tela pajjotam dhāreyya cakkhumantaḥ rūpāni dakkhanti iti
translated: or bring a lamp into the darkness so that one with eyes might see what is there—

original: evamevaṁ bhotā gotamena anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
analyzed: evam evam bhotā gotamena aneka pariyāyena dhammo pakāsito
translated: even so has Master Gotama made the Dhamma clear in many ways.

original: Esāhaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
analyzed: esā aham bhavantam gotamam saraṇam gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhu saṅghañca
translated: I go to Master Gotama for refuge and to the Dhamma and to the Sangha of bhikkhus.

original: Upāsakaṁ maṁ bhavaṁ gotamo dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gatan”ti.
analyzed: upāsakam mam bhavam gotamaḥ dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetam saraṇam gatanti
translated: May Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone to him for refuge, from this day forward, for life.”

original: Cūḷakammavibhaṅgasuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ pañcamaṁ.
analyzed: cūḷakammavibhaṅga suttam niṭṭhitam pañcama
translated: The Shorter Exposition of Action is finished.
